website_summaries.verdict: These pedals deliver an unmatched combination of affordability and durability.
pros: Equipped with hard spindles for strong, steady grip
Large platform shape for easily keeping feet on pedals
Made of corrosion- and abrasion-resistant polyamide

customer_reviews.title: Pedal snappd and caused accident
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pedals a few months back, and they worked decently well. Until yesterday when I was riding and the right pedal just snapped off. This caused me to crash, badly, injuring myself and requiring medical attention. Not only did I injure myself, but I damaged my laptop due to the crash. I would not recommend these to anyone, period. If you are on the fence, get off and get a more reputable pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Stewart

customer_reviews.title: ... these pedals made me think I had found a good pedal for a really good price
customer_reviews.text: All the positive reviews on these pedals made me think I had found a good pedal for a really good price. I have ridden these pedals on my mountain bike (Giant Trance Advanced) in mud and rain for about a month this fall and they are destroyed. Most of the pins have rust on the surface and the bearings on both pedals are loose. I'm disappointed after all the positive reviews but I should have known as you really get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Keith Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great Platforms
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my sons new MB. The item description led me to believe they may be larger than the NukeProof Electrons on my bike so I was concerned they may be a little "too" big. But alas they came in and measure the exact same side/side as the Electrons. Maybe 1mm more thickness but same outsides. Seem to be great product. They actually have more pins than my NukeProofs. If they hold up to abuse they will be a great purchase at $20 compared to the Nukeproofs @ $35.
customer_reviews.author: Turk

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, feels sticky. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: These feel great. My feet finally stick to the pedals and it has changed my whole riding game. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is that one of the bolts had a very-imperfect hex head. My hex key fit one side perfectly and neither metric nor standard keys would fit the other side perfectly. But I could still get it tight with a wrench on the other side and am extremely happy. My feet fit well,
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, used on DH and rough trail
customer_reviews.text: Update: Been running these on my enduro at the local lift assisted bike park. I live there so these pedals get near daily abuse on rougher than average terrain. Plenty of DH tracks, jumps, drops, rock strikes, etc. They're holding up great. I'm sure that they'll break if I have a major rock strike, but don't confuse product quality with rider error. I've been using these on a 29+ hardtail for aggressive trail riding. So far, they've performed as well as the Race Face Chesters I have on my enduro rig. I like them so much that I bought another pair for my wife's rigid fat bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Started "Clicking" with each rotation
customer_reviews.text: These didn't break but they did come lose from the inner stem which causes them to click with each rotation. I have a new bike and wanted something with a little more grip, and these are 5 stars for grip. After about 200 miles they started to wear down. There is nothing visually wrong but I can move them easily up and down when attached to the bike. I put the stock pedals on and will be looking for better pedals/flats.
customer_reviews.author: Michael LaGreca

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking pedal but not sure
customer_reviews.text: The Imrider Lightweight Polyamide Bike Pedals looks like a decent pedal. I know that the pedal will not be roughly used on dirt trails, gravel etc but still felt uncomfortable. They are as plastic as you can get. Very lightweight of course and easy to install. However, the plastic made me think. Its for a family members bike and would not want anyone to get hurt while riding. I gave the Imrider pedal the benefit of the doubt. However, an aluminum pedal will provide peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Good price but doesn't hold up well with pedal strikes
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for the first few months, especially given the price. But after using them for the last 9 months, they haven't held up well to pedal strikes - the bearings in one of the pedals is about to give out, and the other pedal also seems to being having issues with the bearings. I ride cross-country, and average about 1 ride a week in rougher terrain. I'd expect them to fail even faster for downhill or more aggressive riding. If you rarely have pedal strikes these should work OK, otherwise :-(
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: I am super happy with these pedals
customer_reviews.text: I am super happy with these pedals! They look fantastic on my mountain bike and have way better grip and stability than the cheap stock pedals! These pedals hold up to abuse and hind scuffs very well because it is solid polymer instead of just a painted metal surface. Other painted pedals show wear much more readily. I will buy these pedals again and recommend them with enthusiasm!
customer_reviews.author: Jed Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal for the price
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are inexpensive and seem well made. I put them on my Stump Jumper 29er. I've used them on 3 decent length rides, with a lot of single track. I'm currently wearing some Merrill Moab hiking shoes and they stick to the pegs nicely. They've rarely dragged, unless i messed up and got in a rut. Easy to mount, remember the left pedal is reverse-threaded, counter-clockwise to tighten. The right side is standard. I like the fact the studs, which are just little black screws are replaceable. The package even comes with a few replacements. Overall, I'm happy with them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben D.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be afraid of the plastic construction.
customer_reviews.text: For the price these pedals are very good. I upgraded from the basic metal pedals that came on my mountain bike to these and what a difference. I feel like these actually grab my shoes much better than the original pedals. The base is plastic with metal set screw things that stick out. The set screws work very well. I would recommend these over more expensive sets any day. I have done a few 3-5 foot vertical drops and the pedals are still solid. I know a few others that have done 12 foot drops with these pedals with no problems. For any level mountain biker I would recommend, don’t be afraid of the plastic construction.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and don't last
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart while riding after 7 months of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great for limited use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Relatively light weight - Cost - Grip - Smooth bearings Cons: - Not as tough as rocks This pedal would probably have worked better for me if I didn't live in the Southwest, where our trails are very rocky. Part of the flange area broke upon meeting one rock. They still held up for a while, but I was concerned with the area the flange had provided strength to, and replaced them with Chesters. We'll see how those hold up. Maybe plastic isn't the best pedal option around here.
customer_reviews.author: The Gang

customer_reviews.title: Great value, super sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and very grippy. Your feet stay secure on technical single track and bouncy downhill runs with these pedals. I took a big rock hit and thought for sure the pedal got bent or tweaked but surprisingly I actually twisted/bent my Shimano Saint crank. The pedal survived with a minor scuff. Pretty impressive. I've spent a ton more cash on other pedals for other bikes and am now wondering why after trying these. I am very pleased, especially for the price and durability. Good value. They will be my "go to" in the future.
customer_reviews.author: 5280 CO

customer_reviews.title: not super grippy, but good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a cheap alternative to a race face Chester pedal. they look good, fit well and hold up to abuse, but they are not incredibly grippy. they are on an enduro mountain bike and when I ride rocky and choppy terrain, I don't feel very solid on the pedals, as my feet slip around at times. this could be solved with longer pins, but they aren't available unless you buy them separately from a hardware store or the like
customer_reviews.author: Hotpockitrockit

customer_reviews.title: Night and day improvement over stock platform pedals.
customer_reviews.text: Night and day - that's the difference between these and the stock platform pedals that came on my bike. I bought a hybrid, and REI just threw on the standard plastic pedals with the gritty surface - pretty much what you see on most bikes. I researched quite a bit for inexpensive and good pedals and decided on these. I never thought pedals would make such a difference. Now, I haven't hit my shin on them yet. The materials are great. They look and feel very nice.
customer_reviews.author: RicM

customer_reviews.title: amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: i brought this a for a cheap bike, but the quality is so good that i ending putting them in my high end bike , the quality is comparable to the race face chester pedals but half price, even the colors are more vivid than the chester pedals , im been using them for around 100 miles and so far are perfect no problems , very smooth , the pins are good size they really stick to your shoes without been very aggressive .
customer_reviews.author: J.CO.MA

customer_reviews.title: Only ridden a few miles and I'm already surprised at ...
customer_reviews.text: Only ridden a few miles and I'm already surprised at the difference these pedals make compared to the cheap, resin pedals that come stock on most bikes. These allow me to place my feet just a bit further apart, improving both comfort and balance. The studs make my feet feel much more secure on the pedals, allowing me to really put some force into them without worrying as much about slipping. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kinser

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I was rocking some stock pedals, then some cheap metal pedals. Thinking my shoes (DC Anvil's) were the weak point I upgraded to FiveTen's, but my foot was still slipping on rock gardens. I upgraded to these pedals and wham, huge improvement right off the bat. I have to physically lift my foot up off the pedal to move it, it's that stuck using any shoe. I've smashed these into rocks a bunch without shattering or cracking them. You really can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Todish

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky/grindy on first ride.
customer_reviews.text: They work, I don't notice any wobble yet, and they are really grippy......but they made/make a terrible grinding noise since the first ride. I've ridden them on about four rides so far, and no change, and my guess is they'll get worse. It's worst when first starting out, and after a while it's not quite as noticeable, but it's still there. Riding off road it's barely noticeable, but I ride in the rocks of southern Utah, so it's really bumpy which probably dulls the noise. Not bad for the price, and maybe I got a defective bearing, but not very good if you're particular about your bike talking to you when you pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Pippen

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and perfect grip every time.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a difference that made! I should have replaced my crusty pedals long ago but I used to believe that slippery pedals were just a part of biking. These pedals look very nice on my mountain bike and the performance is incredible as they grip my walking shoes (new balance), perfectly every single time. Wet shoes, or terrain, is no longer an issue and I can ride with no hands with much more confidence than before.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Night and day difference
customer_reviews.text: Bought these pedals after looking at some chester pedals. They look to be the same. Anyway, I never owned an aftermarket pair of pedals before. Always just thought a pedal is a pedal... Its a night and day difference though! They stick like glue! For such a small price you actually gain a way better feel. Knowing what I know now, I would pay $50 for these...but I don't have to thanks to imrider.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Wife needed a grippier pedals
customer_reviews.text: My wife wasn't happy with her stock Diamondback pedals, her foot kept sliding. I picked these out of a sea of very similar looking and priced pedals. I guess they are all decent and so is this pair. I like the studs, good plastics, and the bearings. They rotate a lot freer than the stock pedals. I have another pair from different brand on my bike, and I can't tell them apart. Also picked semi-randomly.
customer_reviews.author: YevCoin

customer_reviews.title: Look and feel nice- did have to fight with a stripped grip screw out of the box though...
customer_reviews.text: Look great and feel very high quality. My only complaint was when I went to put them on brand new, there were two loose grip screws. One just wasn't tight, but the real problem was the other screw was actually stripped. This required some fighting on my part to get enough pressure on the screw with a pair of pliers to catch the remaining good part of the thread. Once I got it out I was able to remove it without any issue. Time will tell if there are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pedals at a great price -- but some rust
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pedals at a great price. So far they seem durable (4 months in a Minnesota winter) and they are VERY non-slip. You aren't going to slide your feet around on these, which is great when conditions are icy and cold. I think the plastic helps to keep feet warm, too, by not conducting cold into the sole of your boot when it's quite cold outside. UPDATE: one small downside is that on my winter commuter, the little bolt/nut combinations that provide the grip on the pedals have rusted a good bit. They still seem solid, but the pedals do not look so great. Doesn't matter much on a winter bike but something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Grear value
customer_reviews.text: I thought about giving this item 4 stars based on how heavy they are but decided on five because they are such a great value. This is my second pair, because I got tired of switching the one pair between my two bikes. They have that great concave shape that is in the high end models like the saint from shimano. It didn't seem like any of the other flat pedals under $50 had the concave shape which helps with traction.
customer_reviews.author: DTM

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 Year/600 miles--failed catastrophically
customer_reviews.text: Liked these while they lasted but they broke after 1 year of use. The spindle doesn't go all the way through to a second bearing-- there is only a single bearing holding it all together thats pressed into the pedal--so when it fails your left with a little nubbin of a spindle to try to limp home on. Seriously, spend the extra $20 and get some RaceFace Chesters.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: One of the pedals broke off today. While biking on a busy road, super dangerous, it just snapped off after 4 months..
customer_reviews.author: buydull

customer_reviews.title: very light weight
customer_reviews.text: got these for my city bike to replace the aluminum ones that came with my Fastroad. very easy to install. The pegs offer great grip on whatever you are wearing. Bought a pair for my mountain bike, but haven't tested them (meaning...crashed or banged them on rocks). We'll have to see how they hold up
customer_reviews.author: Charles Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade from stock pedals
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from stock mountain bike pedals, especially for the price. Grip significantly better than stock pedals and are also a larger platform. It comes with the territory - but watch your legs getting grazed because the pins will scratch. Would recommend this as one of the first upgrades to do on a new mountain bikes, especially if not going to clipless pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Z

customer_reviews.title: $20 pedals. don't spend $100
customer_reviews.text: these work fine. pegs hold your foot secure. beware your shins, these pedals will win. i've spent $80 on big brand and these are pretty close in quality. both are imported. purchased for a hybrid/road bike, recreational biker and i put in about 25 miles a week. no signs of leaking grease from bearing. cheap pedals will leak within the first few rides. this color added a bit of bling to my trek. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stivers

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for cycling w/ winter boots
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are just what I needed. I typically use SPD pedals in warm weather but not wanting to pay $400 for winter cycling boots I just use my big clunky winter boots. These pedals give a nice solid foundation for big boots. But the little screws mean you’ve got the equivalent of 0° float. You have to pick up your foot and put it back down again on the pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design making them noisy
customer_reviews.text: They lasted maybe 1 week and then became loose and started clicking. I used them only on paved roads. They have a bearing only on one end and the other end wears out making them loose. Tightening is not helping. Worst spent $20. Should have pay more and buy better quality as I have to do it now anyway.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, affordable pedals
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding clipless for a few months but I didn't want to have to keep dealing with a change of shoes in my office when commuting, so I made the switch to these and couldn't be happier. Super sticky, haven't had an issues with my feet slipping. Very durable and light. I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me (245lbs 6'1") for over 100 miles so far.
customer_reviews.text: I like the spikes on these big pedals, they give me a super secure foot position. Also, the big wide platform reduces foot fatigue. I've ridden over 100 miles with these pedals and I like them a lot. Should be obvious, but if you hit your shin or your calf with these, they will shred your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Russo

customer_reviews.title: best
customer_reviews.text: I am super happy with these pedals! They look fantastic on my mountain bike and have way better grip and stability than the cheap stock pedals! These pedals hold up to abuse and hind scuffs very well because it is solid polymer instead of just a painted metal surface. Other painted pedals show wear much more readily. I will buy these pedals again and recommend them with enthusiasm!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Big, grippy platform never slips!
customer_reviews.text: Light, sturdy, big and extra grippy. Check out the unique design feature that sets these pedals apart. Lots of pedals have some kind of studs to dig into a soft sole shoe but all of those are slick sided studs. These studs are hex screws mounted thru the pedal and they are jaggedly ribbed in machine thread for super bite! Big platform supports an adult foot very well. My size 13 Sketchers never slip. Well made and perfect for MTB. I used these to replace the stock pedals on my new 29er.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Best Value for Trail Worth Pedals
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are an absolutely ridiculous value for the money. I’ve probably bought half a dozen sets by now, ridden them on double black trails and bike park days in the desert southwest, and I’ve never had a single issue. I keep buying these over any other flat pedals I’ve tried, even those costing 7 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Syme

customer_reviews.title: Good grip and price
customer_reviews.text: I put sets of pedals on three mountain bikes and all users like the product. We had the junky OEM pedals on the bikes previously, so the grip on this product is far superior. My only concern is the durability of the studs. I see a couple missing already, so it looks like it could be a high-maintenance part. If you are buying them for a young rider, they will have to learn to keep their legs clear of the pedals, or else their leg will be impaled by the studs.
customer_reviews.author: CHERI R.

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: I'd had a set of these on my commuter for a year or two now, and just put a second set on my trail bike. They seem to hold up well, and haven't given me any major issues. The only thing that I can really say is wrong with them is that the spikes are just a little bit too tall, and are great at tearing into shins. These work just as well as the name-brand ones, but at a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Boynton

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from stock pedals
customer_reviews.text: Love the way the pedals look and I’m getting used to the feel. I’ve never had pedals that where this aggressive before so they hold great but sometime I have to move my foot around at first to get it in the right spot. I’m also hoping that the spikes don’t catch my leg at any point because that would not feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely terrific. I use them on my Sun EZ Sport recumbent. My feet used to slip all over the place over bumps and during gear changes. Rock solid footing today! They are stylish and lightweight and come with a couple extra studs. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rickert

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids bike
customer_reviews.text: These are nice pedals, but I made a mistake putting these in my son’s bike (8 years old). The spikes in the pedal are sharp as hell and shredded by kids shin after a half hour of use. You want this much grip make sure you are experienced enough to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalex

customer_reviews.title: Using these is soooooooooo much better! They grip so good takes some major movement ...
customer_reviews.text: First time using any pedals other than the basic smaller type that always come on bikes. Using these is soooooooooo much better! They grip so good takes some major movement to change the placement of my feet. I only ride on the street but I am not gentle on my bike at all. So far these are doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Sacapuntas69

customer_reviews.title: Just bought my second pair for a second bike!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of these in 2017 and they been swapped between two bikes and ridden nearly every day with zero issues. I live in Montana and ride year around. An older set of pedals started failing on me so I decided to pickup another set of these. They are very grippy and thinner than my older set of pedals.
customer_reviews.author: N. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: These are the best of the inexpensive MTB pedals you can find on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried most of the sub-$30 pedals over the past couple years. These are by far the best. I ride mostly with Vans shoes. I have slowly replaced all the pedals on all my bikes with these, because they are so nice and comfortable and durable. They are equally useful to me on a road bike for commuting or touring, or fat bike, or MTB on singletrack. Excellent, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Allmut LandLine Sprogresi

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than included pedals
customer_reviews.text: I bought an inexpensive Euro Mini folding bike. The bike is nice but the folding pedals didn't last. I never fold the pedals so these are perfect. Great grip that my previous pedals didn't have. Very light weight. My only complaint was pedals don't have a reflector for street use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Not the most durable
customer_reviews.text: These were great pedals for the price until they weren't. I like the large pedal surface and the pins that do a great job of gripping your feet, however after riding them for a few months, my left pedal broke off the spindle. These are probably better for the more casual rider. I easily ride 100+ miles a week on average. I defiantly wouldn't recommend these to anyone that rides a lot. I've since brought a more expensive and seemingly more quality pair of pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Prentis

customer_reviews.title: Decent looking Peddles.,  What's a few loose screws.
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be a good purchase I only road one mile with it but I noticed 3 of the screws are stripped meaning the nut in the screw are stripped and I cannot tighten them and I'm afraid I'm going to lose the individual screw and the opposing nut. I would like to receive several more screws and associated nuts to replace this one for I'm afraid it'll be lost without me knowing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: lighter than race face, super strong
customer_reviews.text: I went into my LBS shop and got a really nice compliment on these. They are super light and very strong, I beat the crap out of these. the adjustable screws are really nice. I got mine in black but the colors are a solid option. way cheaper than the competition, no reason to buy the brand name pedals unless you are a brand name nerd.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Coombe

customer_reviews.title: 356g per pair, excellent grip and durability
customer_reviews.text: I have these on my fixed/single speed bike and absolutely love them. Coming in at 178g per pedal you really can't beat them especially for the price. I have owned them since July 2017 so for 8 months I have road hard on them and not slipped once, now that's a great pedal especially when being planted is so important (fixed gear riding). 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟🌟 the company offers great customer service as well!
customer_reviews.author: The Review

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap pedals.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great low budget pedal. I've bought two pair for my bikes and I've been happy with both. I have a pair of Raceface Chesters on one bike and I can say these are just as good but half the price. Color options are nice. The teal/turquoise isn't very bright unfortunately. The red look almost exactly as advertised though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Big flat platform!
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Rode them yesterday for the first time. Bike started to wash out on a downhill switchback and I saved myself from a fall by getting my foot down quickly. Couldn't have done that with baskets or my clips. These are a big wide platform that feels really secure. No slipping.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: The pedals are about 4. 25in wide (front to ...
customer_reviews.text: The pedals are about 4.25in wide (front to back) and almost 4in wide across (just the plastic part). This offered a more broad pedal than than my old pedals. The pedal Screws develop a small amount of rust around the edges but it wears off when you ride.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: These were a huge upgrade over my cheapo pedals on my 2017 Nishiki Colorado 29er. It isn't an expensive bike so i didn't feel justified buying anything more expensive than these pedals, and I'm glad i didn't. they work great. going of small drops used to send my feet flying off the pedals, but now my feet stay glued to the pedals even when going off small drops.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A great value composite flat pedal
customer_reviews.text: This pedal actually surprised me. I purchased for a stationary spinner to better emulate my bike. The pedal seems well made, is grippy, and has replaceable pins. Would recommend for anyone looking for a inexpensive composite pedal. Did not give 5 stars only because I have not tested on my MTB.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davila

customer_reviews.title: If you like getting cut, these are for you.
customer_reviews.text: While these pedals are a great price and provide traction, the screws are not buffed and will definitely cut your shins or calfs if you are not careful. The pedal design have eight screws, five on the forefoot and three at the heel. In order to use less screws, the design has very sharp screws. They lasted me a couple hundred miles but the cuts are not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pbcville

customer_reviews.title: Great grip
customer_reviews.text: These have held up well for me and are still in good shape after one season on a commuter bike and one season on my trail mountain bike. They taken plenty of pedal strikes and are no worse for the wear. Great grip with my 5-10 mountain biking shoes. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: James Bond

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals - used on commute bike
customer_reviews.text: I use these on a commute road bike. I am a relatively light weight rider (63kg / 140 LBS) but these pedals have seen some serious punishment in the form of: riding on very rough roads, hitting into the sidewalk, hitting stairs - Been riding them for an average of 3 hours a week for the better part of a year and so far they are holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tal M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple
customer_reviews.text: Just a little bit wider and longer than a standard pedal. I'm using it without the pegs installed. Each pedal is about 160 grams without any pegs/pins. Don't freely spin for long, so not sure if that causes friction over the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable. Still look good after many miles.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put about 500 miles on these pedals and I think they are fantastic. I like them much more than I thought I would. I suspect I will probably get at least a couple thousand more miles, unless I get bored with them and want a change. I would say these are well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: JLLDHR

customer_reviews.title: Bought three sets.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three sets and had a short time but like them so far. I'm one of those folks whose feet point out. I used to have to buy the spacers that go between the crank arm and the pedal to give more 'Q' space. With these I don't need those. Came back for a fourth set and jumped from $19.99 to $26.99 in a matter of a couple weeks? I'll wait a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Matarella

customer_reviews.title: Look and feel great, but broke in under a year.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and feel of these pedals but one of mine completely broke after 11 months. I really loved the rigid feel and the bolt spikes in them and how grippy they were in inclement weather but the center metal rod just completely broke today in the middle of my ride. I've never crashed or ran the pedals into anything. Just normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Just threw them on my bike a few days ago. They come well packaged. The red is a bit lighter than i would like (approaching pink) but is still indeed red. The bolts for traction really grip to the bottom of your shoe, do not notice any tearing or wear on the soul of my converses after 2 days of riding. Took a VERY hard rock hit to one my second time out, put a good gash into the corner of one of the pedals but it is hardly noticeable due to the matching colored plastic underneath and no actual structural damage to the pedal. Impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: These are very affordable and have worked well for me ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very affordable and have worked well for me. I ride single track several times a week and have not splurged for mountain biking shoes. I use running shoes. The screws are a bit aggressive and cat cut up the front of your legs. Especially when pushing the bike up hills.
customer_reviews.author: Castillonis

customer_reviews.title: Love these pedals and the price is perfect for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals and the price is perfect for my urban horse. I bike fast (old bmx/freestyle girl...haha) and these pedals keep you glued onto place...I love that you can adjust the "spikes" so I can have them flatter on one side for when I wear my nice sandals/shoes to work/out on the town. I am one happy girl so far.
customer_reviews.author: AlliKia

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and durable
customer_reviews.text: These are affordable alternatives to the higher priced RaceFace brand. Though up it’s tough to say how they will hold up in the long term, I am happy with the weight and look and feel. Solid grip and easy to install! Better quality than cheap plastic replace,Mets from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burt

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are amazing! They had great grip and traction for everything, but whatchout because I landed wrong and the pedal hit the shin. Ended up ripping through my favorite pants and got a nice gash in my shin. Not like it hasnot happend before but just watch out. Nevertheless these pedals are amazing, 100 times better than stock.
customer_reviews.author: R.L

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, light, and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the stock pedals I had on my bmx bike since I was looking for something customizable that would grip my feet. Absolutely love them, they are light weight and grip my shoes well making crank flips a breeze, not to mention they are durable since I’ve put them through some tough action! I’m debating on getting a pair for my mtb as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bartko

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedals, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for the price. My bike mechanic spent over twice as much for race face chesters and he couldn't tell the difference other than decals. Mine also came with spare screws. Exactly like chesters, better price. I wouldn't doubt if they are made by the same manufacturer, just different branding. By the way, your shoes stick to these pedals very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far these have held up well for me. I have banged the pegs on a few rocks but none had broken or needed replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Southstar

customer_reviews.title: starting clicking every time I pedal
customer_reviews.text: They started clicking everything I pedal a couple days after the 1st year of owning them. I tried emailing the seller but they never replied. I tried to Tighten the screw but it was stripped. TRASH!
customer_reviews.author: Migs

customer_reviews.title: Work well for commuting in regular shoes
customer_reviews.text: These were as easy to install as any other pedal and they worked well for commuting in regular shoes. I wear shoes with very little tread and never felt any slipping off the pedal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals.
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding these pedals for about 6 months. They have took a beating and still preforn flawlessly. They are light and thin. They are nice and big and provide excellent grip. Combined with my 510s they are almost too gripping. Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Loved these pedals...BUT...one fell off while I was transporting my bike.
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are really nice, grippy, lightweight, solid material, easy to install....BUT...just under a year of owning them I put my bike on my car rack and drove to some trails, and when I got there, I noticed one of the pedals had fallen off. I'm not sure how it happened, but it did. I was still able to ride, but obviously a bit more difficult. I'm thinking maybe this was just a random event? Who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets for my two Mountain bikes. I was surprised by how well they work. Lighter than the stock pedals that came on my Trek MBTs. They provide great traction and are holding up quite well so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Color is a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the orange pedals but they’re more of a scarlet color. Not too disappointed because of how much an improvement they are over my stock pedals but I wanted a color scheme going and it kinda doesn’t work with the rest of my bike. Great pedals otherwise, the pins grab great and they spin way better than my old ones. Only buy these if you don’t care what color they are 😂
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered these pedals to replace my temporary medal pedals on my new mountain bike. I was continuing to scrape my shins when I mounted and dismounted my bike. These pedals definitely resolve that issue. For the price the quality is exceptional and the more I use them the more I can further tune the pegs for the perfect grip on my shoe. I would highly recommend these pedals and plan on buying a second pair in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for $20, Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box they seem to be of decent construction for the $20 price tag. These are made in China so don’t expect them to substitute RaceFace Chester’s. I purchased these as cheap grippy pedals for my single speed beater/commuter. I won’t be taking these on any trails but they are great as a cheap alternative to other more expensive platforms. Only came with two extra pins. Nothing particularly impressive about these but hopefully they are more durable than my stock pedals.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Love these pedals!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals. Second pair I have bought but only because I got a new bike and I love the orange! The ones on my other bike are still great a year later and about 1500 miles of singletrack later. They have been hit, rained on, hosed off, ran through mud, bashed off rocks and have never so much as lost a single screw. They take a beating and hold up well! Half the price of comps and they seem equivalent in style and durability. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amity Howard

customer_reviews.title: Peddling Pedals
customer_reviews.text: I decided to replace my stock pedals. These were good looking and pretty cheap. I checked out the reviews, pulled the trigger, and I have been totally happy. They work great, fit well, look nice, have great traction, and came with replacement spikes. So far I am 100% happy. If anything changes I will update here.
customer_reviews.author: C. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Sexy pedals for a sexy price
customer_reviews.text: I see pedals in bike shops for over $100 that look exactly the same as these. I love these things. My feet stick to them like glue and they come in all sorts of awesome colors. Havent had any of the pins fall out since I bought them 8 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent pedals
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my around town bike. I've had em a few weeks, and so far they seem nice enough. I deducted a star because one of the pedals clicks with every revolution. The issue is somewhere along the spindle. Otherwise, no complaints. update: 2 years later and still going strong. stopped clicking relatively soon afterward. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hawk

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE QUALITY.  BROKE AFTER ONE WEEK OF USE.  HORRIBLE SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: After one week of using these pedals, they broke. Was riding, and all of a sudden the pedal fell off, and was not able to be put back on. So I was left riding home with one pedal. IT was pretty dissapointing. I tried to contact the seller and never got a response. Hence I am leaving this bad review. I would stay away from these pedals. Also, the install was not great. The pedals went on crooked and do not have a great easy fit.
customer_reviews.author: madelyn murray rigby

customer_reviews.title: Great value. No reason to spend more.
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong. Couple thousand miles on them for street,downhill,and cross country on Trek Marlin 7. Just took a look and even the spikes are still in good shape. Definitely took some hits and have some war wounds but appear to still be going strong. I wear 5-10 Freerider Pros with them. Got to match my bike too. Buy em.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Take care of your feet!
customer_reviews.text: READ THE INDICATOR FOR L OR R BEFORE INSTALLING! Maybe it's common sense but I haven't had a bike in awhile so I forgot. Easy to install and transforms peddling! Great grip!
customer_reviews.author: MiCoats

customer_reviews.title: Good feel, good grip
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 stars... A much wider platform than the stock pedals which is nice. The grip I get feels so solid I could not imagine slipping off in any weather conditions. None of my standard wrenches fit (too wide) so I did have to purchase a pedal wrench so something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: broke after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: The good: I liked the wide footprint and the metal studs that gripped my tennis shoes The bad: the shaft broke after 10 months. Although, I must say that I ride pretty hard and have probably put about 1,500 miles on these pedals. But mostly on the road as I don't think I did any trails with these pedals. The ugly: See the picture that shows the missing threaded end of the pedal. The shaft broke about 3/4 inches into the pedal. As my last pedals of a different brand only lasted 6 months, I think I need to start buying more expensive pedals.
customer_reviews.author: JPK from LA

customer_reviews.title: Great flat petals
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have pointed out these are the same size and appear to be the same material as the nukeproof electrons. I have now ridden with them three times, steep technical and fast flowing downhill. I didn't worry about my feet once. No slipping. They will get beat up with rock strikes over time but for this price who cares?
customer_reviews.author: BuzztheKiller

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP and broken
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get these because the grip is great! The fun colors make it excited but they are poorly made. I put them on my MTB and they broke my second day of riding. I wasn’t even doing hard trails or crashing. I broke the internal pin in the pedal from pedaling to hard. If you are looking for an upgrade. Don’t get these and just spend the extra $20 for a nicer set.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Urlie

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap pedals
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap pedals. Who cares if they only last a season or 2, they are a fraction of the price of name brand pedals. They are also pretty light.
customer_reviews.author: fishy

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals for a cheap price!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say...these pedals are nice and big and provide great grip and stability. I have seen and ridden on more expensive pedals and there isn't much of a difference. Save your money. Get these. Tough construction and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: SINA M JAMSHED

customer_reviews.title: Priced great.  Work great.
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals at a great price. They grip your shoes great. Will give you battle wounds if they catch you skin so stay on top of your bike. They will help keep you stable on your bike. The rest is up to you.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals!
customer_reviews.text: Got as an upgrade for my mountain bike and love them! Very sticky on the trails. Gonna hurt real bad the first time my legs come into contact with them on a fall!
customer_reviews.author: Austin R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Better than Chester
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great. I replaced the Raceface Chesters I had that were missing pins and partially smashed. These hold up better to rock strikes & none of the pins have bent or fallen out. For the $$$ paid, an awesome value 😎
customer_reviews.author: J. Todd

customer_reviews.title: good grip. Be sure to have hard soles on ...
customer_reviews.text: Light, solid pedals, good grip. Be sure to have hard soles on your shoes or these will rip 'em to shreds!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Mc

customer_reviews.title: Bomb Stickity
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are probably among the best pedals i have ever owned. If you are a mountain biker that is considering these pedals, leave them in your cart, click on BUY, and put them on your bike. You'll love 'em. And for the price, you'll be amazed. . . Awesome pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for town, I would mountain bike or BMX with them.
customer_reviews.text: Super cheap upgrade for any bike running stock pedals. They are made of plastic so I would be worried if I used these for mountain biking since a hard pedal strike could probably break them... around town they are perfect and super grippy.
customer_reviews.author: OneJazzyMomma

customer_reviews.title: insane good bike pedals
customer_reviews.text: i bought a bike for college and ever since I put these pedals on compared to my old ones, they're way better and more durable when it comes to grip and etc.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Light and not expensive. I love em!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them! Light. Nice platform for any footwear! Went on so easy! Took me about 5-10 minutes. If you're looking for pedals I would recommend these! I've been riding for 22 year's. I had a pair of these but they were for a BMX bike. These stick out from the crank giving my foot more comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

product_meta.title: Imrider Lightweight Polyamide Bike Pedals for BMX Road MTB Bicycle
feature_bullets: Safe: Hard spindles produce strong grips to your bicycle to help prevent a sudden disconnection.
Advantage: Antiskid nail surface, strong grasps, no longer skid. Big platform shape for long ride comfort and pedaling efficiency.
Material: Made of high quality polyamide, good abrasion resistance and corrosion resistant
Suitable for: BMX, cruisers bicycle, kids' bikes, road bicycles, MTB bicycle, mountain bicycles, junior bicycle, city bicycle, etc

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
